title: Small Stuff Makes Big Bear Itch

content.en: A big white bear lives in a zoo. People love seeing him. He's fun to watch.
content.tw: 動物園住著一頭大白熊，許多人很喜歡去拜訪牠。

content.en: But the bear was scratching his body a lot. His white fur was falling out!
content.tw: 但是白熊最近一直抓身體，漂亮的毛開始掉落！這是怎麼回事呢？

content.en: Everyone was worried. What was wrong? No one knew. So the zoo's doctor came to help. She gave the bear a test. And, the bear has allergies! His body doesn't like some things. The things aren't bad, but they make him itch.
content.tw: 大家很擔心，找醫生來檢查，原來白熊是過敏兒！有一些東西會讓他皮膚超級癢。

content.en: The bear has some allergies that many people have. He has an allergy to a very small bug's poop! He has an allergy to flower pollen! Pollen makes people sneeze in the spring. And he has an allergy to very small pieces of people's skin!
content.tw: 大白熊跟很多人類一樣，對小蟲大便、花粉，還有人類皮膚的小小粉屑過敏！

content.en: Why do zoo animals get allergies? Well, they live in clean places. There aren't many bugs. And these animals don't get dirty! So their bodies don't learn what's safe and what's not safe for them. Their bodies think safe things are bad.
content.tw: 動物竟然會過敏！那是因為動物園內太乾淨、一塵不染，所以身體誤以為那些小東西有危險，才會開始發癢。

content.en: The doctor gave the bear some medicine with honey. Now he doesn't itch!
content.tw: 醫生開給大白熊的皮膚藥，混合著蜂蜜！大白熊喜愛蜂蜜，順便把藥吃下去，就不癢了！

content.en: Do you have any allergies?
content.tw: 你有過敏嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 動物園裡的熊，有時候會過敏，身上發癢。

content.text:
1. wrong 有毛病。
I can't seem to stop scratching. 我好像沒辦法停止搔癢。
What's wrong with me? 我這是怎麼了?
Maybe it's an allergy. 也許是過敏。
You've got a rash on your face.你臉上也有紅疹。

2. itch 癢。
That's just great.這下可好了。
First it's itching, now my face.先是發癢，然後是臉。
It could be your room. 可能是你的房間。

3. clean 乾淨的。
What about my room? 我的房間如何?
It's not clean. 不乾淨。
My room is perfectly clean! 我的房間完全乾淨!

4. skin 皮膚。
No, I mean your bed. 不，我是說你的床。
It has many small pieces of your skin.床上有很多你的皮膚碎屑。
And it could trigger allergies. 那有可能引發過敏。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很常用到。
wrong有毛病 itch癢 clean乾淨的 skin皮膚

quiz.question: 1. What was happening to the bear's white fur?
options: b. It was learning what's safe.

quiz.question: 2. What does the bear have an allergy to?
3. Why do zoo animals sometimes get allergies?
options: a. They eat too many bugs.
b. They play and get dirty.
c. They live in very clean places.

content.en: There are many kinds of races. There's car racing. There's horse racing. And there's pigeon racing!
content.tw: 比賽種類繁多，有賽車，賽馬，還有賽鴿。不過我們這裡講的賽鴿，很不一樣。

content.en: In Southern Taiwan, it's pigeon whistle racing. Why? It's because the pigeons fly with a whistle.
content.tw: 台灣南部有很傳統的放鴿笭比賽，鴿笭會發出像吹哨子一樣的聲音。

content.en: Pigeon whistles are not like the little whistles we use. They are big wooden whistles. They have two wooden circles. They go on the pigeons' backs. When the pigeons fly, air goes through the whistles. The whistles make a sound!
content.tw: 鴿笭跟普通哨子不一樣，它是師傅親手做的木頭盒子，綁在鴿子背上。鴿子飛行時風穿過鴿笭就發出聲音。

content.en: The race takes four hours. One hundred pigeons fly from one village to another village. Then they fly back home. They fly about one kilometer.
content.tw: 整場比賽大約四小時，上百隻鴿子從一個村莊飛到另外一個，再飛回來原處，距離一公里左右。

content.en: People in the villages try to catch the pigeons. Then they take the whistles off of the pigeons. They are careful with the whistles. These whistles are made by hand. Only one man in Tainan makes them.
content.tw: 村民會想辦法捕捉鴿子，把鴿笭小心地拿下來。這些鴿笭現在只有一位在台南的師傅會做。

content.en: Who wins? The village that gets the most whistles wins! What does it win? It wins a big dinner! The village that loses the race pays for the dinner.
content.tw:
輸贏怎麼決定呢? 哪個村莊取得最多鴿笭就獲勝!
輸掉的村莊必須擺桌，請贏家大吃一頓!

content.en: Pigeon whistle racing sounds like fun!
content.tw: 鴿笭比賽聽起來很有趣!

vocabulary.preface: 古老的放鴿笭比賽，已經成為台南和嘉義的特色活動。

content.text:
1. why 為什麼。
When I was little, 我小時候，
our neighbor kept a big cage of pigeons on the roof.
我的鄰居在屋頂上養了好大一籠鴿子。
Why did he need so many pigeons? 他為什麼要那麼多鴿子?

2. race 比賽。
Because he wanted them to race! 因為他想要鴿子去比賽。
He could get money if they win. 要是那些鴿子贏了，他就可以賺錢。

3. circle 圓圈。
Every morning he let the birds out. 他每天早上把鴿子放出去。
He waved a big flag and the pigeons would fly in circles.
他揮舞一面大旗子，鴿子會繞圈圈飛。

4. sound 聲音。
I was often woken up by the sounds. 我經常被那些聲音吵醒。
Then they all went back to the cage. 然後牠們就全部回到籠子裡。
That's amazing! 滿厲害的!

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很簡單。
why為什麼 race比賽 circle圓圈 sound聲音

quiz.question: 1. What do pigeon whistles have?
2. What does a village need to win this race?
3. What do the winners of this race win?

content.en: We need to buy vegetables! But it isn't time to eat. It's time to make music! Yes, vegetables can make music!
content.tw: 買蔬菜的時間到囉! 這些蔬菜不是用來吃的，而是當作樂器演奏!

content.en: In Austria, an orchestra plays music with vegetables. It's the Vegetable Orchestra! It wants to show we can make music from anything!
content.tw: 奧地利有個蔬菜管弦樂團，他們想告訴大家音樂隨手可得，用蔬菜瓜果都可以。

content.en: This orchestra has been making music for 27 years. It has played 344 shows! That's a world record for the most shows by a vegetable orchestra!
content.tw: 他們已經有二十七年歷史，總共表演了344次。這是世界上蔬菜管弦樂團表演次數最多的團體。

content.en: What do the musicians play? They play carrot recorders, cucumber saxophones, radish bass flutes, leek violins, and more.
content.tw:
他們用些什麼東西當樂器呢?
胡蘿蔔，小黃瓜，白蘿蔔，韭菜都可以做成笛子，薩克斯風，或是小提琴等等。

content.en: The musicians make new instruments for each show. That means every show sounds different.
content.tw: 這些音樂家為每一場表演從頭製作樂器，這也讓每一場表演都不一樣。

content.en: Sometimes the instruments break. But the show goes on!
content.tw: 有時候蔬菜樂器甚至突然斷裂，但是表演還是得繼續下去!

content.en: For some people, the best part of the show is at the end. That's when everyone can have vegetable soup! Making the instruments makes lots of small vegetable pieces too. They go in the soup!
content.tw: 很多觀眾最喜歡表演的最後階段，因為那時候大家都可以得到一碗熱騰騰的蔬菜湯。製作樂器會產生許多小塊蔬菜，這些都會加到湯裡！

content.en: A vegetable show with vegetable soup sounds great!
content.tw: 蔬菜管弦樂團的表演，還有蔬菜湯可以喝，聽起來很棒!

vocabulary.preface: 蔬菜管弦樂團的表演非常特別。

content.text:
1. violin 小提琴。
What's that noise? 那是什麼噪音?
It's my daughter learning to play violin. 是我女兒在學小提琴。
I'm sorry, but it's awful! 真抱歉，但是好難聽。
I agree. 我同意。

2. musician 音樂家。
But, hey, every great musician started off like that.
但是每個偉大的音樂家都是那樣開始的。
So that's what you want her to be? 所以你想要她成為那樣?

3. anything 任何事。
No, she can do anything she wants. 不是，她可以做任何她想做的事。
Yeah, if she happens to love music, that would be nice.
對啊，假如她恰好喜歡音樂也很好。

4. end 結尾或是最終。
Well, in the end, at least it's not drums. 至少到頭來她不是學打鼓。
Indeed! 確實是。

vocabulary.postscript:
來跟我一起讀單字。
violin小提琴 musician音樂家 anything任何事 end結尾或是最終

quiz.question: 1. What country is the orchestra in?
2. Which world record does the orchestra have?
options: a. The most shows by a vegetable orchestra

quiz.question: 3. What can people do at the end of a show?

title: A Farm of Fish and Fruit

content.en: Do you love fresh strawberries?! They're in strawberry tarts, strawberry milk, strawberry tánghúlu! Yum yum yum!
content.tw: 草莓香甜可口，草莓塔、草莓牛奶、草莓糖葫蘆都好吃!

content.en: Farmers in Yunlin have a new way to grow strawberries. They say their strawberries taste much better than other strawberries! What makes the fruit taste so good? Vegetable waste from the farms, and fish do! Huh? What?!
content.tw: 雲林的農夫嘗試種植草莓的新辦法，種出來的草莓不但美味，還減少了蔬菜垃圾量，讓養殖魚類長得更好。這是怎麼回事?

content.en: Nutrients make vegetables good for us. They make vegetable waste good for fish too! The fish eat the nutrients. Over time, the fish fill the water with these nutrients.
content.tw: 農夫跟養殖漁業合作，把要丟棄的蔬菜葉子拿去餵魚，蔬菜是很營養的東西，魚吃下肚之後的排泄物，也讓魚塭水富含養分。

content.en: The farmers use the fish water for their strawberry plants. The strawberries grow better! And the plants grow strawberries a month longer. Now we can eat them from December to May!
content.tw: 用魚塭水澆灌草莓，讓草莓又大又紅，還能多生長一個月，從十二月到五月都吃的到。

content.en: The farmers pick the strawberries. They give the waste water to the fish. It's a big circle: vegetable waste, fish, water, strawberries, vegetable waste, fish... Nothing is thrown away! And farmers don't need to buy fish and plant food.
content.tw: 剩餘的草莓葉子，還可以拿去餵魚。所以這是個很健康的循環，廢棄蔬菜，魚，水，草莓都不浪費，農夫也不用買肥料給草莓施肥。

content.en: This new way of farming is good for farmers, the Earth, and us! Vegetable waste and fish make delicious strawberries! Mmmm-mm!
content.tw: 這種新型態的農業對農夫、地球和我們都很好，蔬菜廢料和魚類讓草莓更美味!嗯嗯嗯!

vocabulary.preface: 草莓和魚類沒什麼關係，但是雲林這家農場成功推動讓草莓和魚類共生。

content.text:
1. vegetable 蔬菜。
Is tomato fruit or vegetable? 番茄是水果還是蔬菜?
Vegetable, if it's the big one. 假如是大番茄，那是蔬菜。
It can be used in soup, in salad and various dishes.可以用來煮湯，做沙拉，或是各種菜。

2. fruit 水果。
I prefer small tomatoes.我喜歡小番茄。
You can find the fruit all year round. 一年到頭都吃得到的水果。

3. fresh 新鮮的。
But my favorite fruit is still watermelon.不過我最喜歡的水果還是西瓜。
Nothing comes close to fresh, icy cold watermelon on a hot summer day.
什麼都比不上炎熱的夏天來一片新鮮冰西瓜。

4. milk 牛奶。
Have you ever tried watermelon milk?你有沒有喝過西瓜牛奶?
No, is it good? 沒，好喝嗎?
It's great, believe me.很棒，相信我。

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起讀單字。
vegetable蔬菜 fruit水果 fresh新鮮的 milk牛奶

quiz.question: 1. Where do farmers have a new way to grow strawberries?
2. When can we eat fresh strawberries now?
3. What is this new way of farming good for?

content.en: Sunday is International Museum Day. Museums show us many things. In Croatia, one museum is about laughter!
content.tw: 星期天是國際博物館日!博物館帶給我們很多新知識，克羅埃西亞有個歡笑博物館!

content.en: Some people say, "Laughter is the best medicine." It can make you feel good!
content.tw: 歡笑是最好的良藥，可以治癒不順利，帶來好心情，對我們很重要!

content.en: The museum wants to show this. Kids laugh here. Grown-ups laugh too!
content.tw: 這個博物館想告訴我們歡笑的重要，在博物館裡，大人小孩會一同歡笑。

content.en: When you go inside, air blows on you and your worries go away! You go into a big washing machine. You go around and around, and then you slide down! White balls are all around you! You can jump and play with them!
content.tw: 一走進館裡，一陣風會把你的煩惱吹到遠遠地，再來你會走進一個大洗衣機，順著圈圈溜~~下球池玩耍!

content.en: You can laugh at rubber chickens singing songs! You can learn about what makes people laugh!
content.tw: 博物館裡的橡膠雞唱歌也很好笑！你可以了解什麼東西會讓人笑！

content.en: Telling jokes makes people laugh. Slapstick makes people laugh too. With slapstick, people do silly things. Maybe you have seen a clown slipping on a banana. That's slapstick! At the museum, you can do slapstick with sumo wrestling!
content.tw: Slapstick 是滑稽喜劇，演員表演無厘頭的事情來搞笑，像是踩到香蕉皮跌倒，在博物館裡，你可以穿上相撲裝跟朋友撞來撞去!

content.en: What makes you laugh? Whatever it is, laughter is good for you. Maybe it is the best medicine!
content.tw: 你覺得什麼東西最好笑?不管是什麼，歡笑對我們都很好，或許它真的是最好的良藥!

vocabulary.preface: 讓人發笑的博物館，你會不會也想去參觀?

content.text:
1. go away 走開。
I've found a new way to make my worries go away. 我找到新辦法趕走我的憂慮。
Don't tell me it's singing. 別告訴我是唱歌。
No, but singing does help. 不是，不過唱歌是有幫助。

2. joke 笑話。
Then what is it? 那是什麼?
Telling myself a joke every morning. 每天早上跟我自己講個笑話。
That actually sounds funny.聽起來是很好笑。

3. laughter 歡笑。
Right? A little laughter can change your day. 是吧?
一點歡笑就可以改變一整天。

4. laugh 笑。
I find it hard to laugh at my own jokes.我覺得笑自己講的笑話有點難。
That's not a problem.那不是問題。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很有趣。
go away走開 joke笑話 laughter歡笑 laugh笑

quiz.question: 1. Why do some people say laughter is medicine?
options: a. It makes people feel sick.
b. It makes people feel good.
c. It makes people feel strong.

quiz.question: 2. Who likes going to the museum about laughter?
3. What happens with slapstick?

title: Be Careful Walking on Taiwan's Roads

content.en: When you are walking to school or somewhere else, you have to be careful. Many drivers are not careful!
content.tw: 我們都知道行人要注意安全，但有時候不小心的是汽車駕駛!

content.en: In Taoyuan, some kids wanted to cross the road. They used a crosswalk. But eleven cars didn't stop for them. The kids gave up!
content.tw: 在桃園，幾個小朋友想走斑馬線過馬路，但是十一輛汽車沒有一輛停下來!

content.en: Those kids were not hurt. But last year In Taiwan, 366 people walking on roads were killed. That's one person every day! Taichung, Taoyuan, and New Taipei were the most dangerous. Kids need to be very careful.
content.tw: 好險他們沒有受傷，但去年台灣有 366 個行人因為車禍喪命，台中、桃園跟新北市特別危險。

content.en: What can you do? Walk on sidewalks. When there's no sidewalk, walk facing cars. Then you can see cars coming. You can move to a safer place if a driver doesn't see you.
content.tw: 小朋友該怎麼做才好呢?一定要好好走在人行道上，如果沒有人行道，那至少要面對車子走，確定你和司機都看得到對方。

content.en: Cross streets at crosswalks. Before you cross, look both ways: left, right, and left again. Listen for cars too. Some cars don't stop at red lights! Wear bright colors. That helps drivers see you.
content.tw: 過馬路一定要走斑馬線，並且觀察左右兩邊，仔細聽車子的聲音，也可以穿明亮的顏色，讓司機清楚看到你!

content.en: And walking with friends is fun, but don't play or push each other! Someone might fall on the road.
content.tw: 跟朋友一起走的時候，絕對不要在路上推來推去哦!要是跌到路中央就危險了!

content.en: Be careful and stay safe when you are walking on or near a road!
content.tw: 走在馬路上要小心，保持安全!

vocabulary.preface: 走在馬路上要注意四周的各種車輛，並且儘量走人行道。

content.text:
1. driver 駕駛。
I hate it when drivers do that! 真討厭駕駛那樣!
I know, it's so annoying. 我知道，是很煩!

2. sidewalk 人行道。
But I think he did it because you didn't walk on the sidewalk.
不過他那樣是因為你沒有走人行道。
It's all wet! 那裏都濕濕的。
It's better than getting hit by a car. 總比被車子撞到好吧。

3. safe 安全的。
There are often bikers and things on sidewalks.
人行道上經常有騎腳踏車的人跟東西。
They don't feel safe to me. 我不覺得它安全。

4. safer 比較安全的。
It's still safer than stepping into traffic. 還是比走進車陣裏面安全。
Hey, it's a yellow light. Don't run! 已經黃燈了，不要跑。
I'm walking. 我是用走的。
You should stop! 你應該停下來!

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起讀單字。
driver駕駛 sidewalk人行道 safe安全的 safer比較安全的

quiz.question: 1. What happened in Taoyuan?
options: a. Eleven kids crossed a road.
b. Eleven kids played on the road.
c. Eleven cars didn't stop for kids.

quiz.question: 2. What do you see when you walk facing cars?
3. Which is the safest thing to do?
options: b. Look both ways before crossing a road.
c. Wear dark clothes at night.

content.en: Bees are yellow and black. They fly from flower to flower. This helps make food for us. But bees need help, so today is World Bee Day.
content.tw: 蜜蜂每天飛來飛去散播花粉，可是很辛苦的! 大家趁著今天是蜜蜂日，和牠們說辛苦囉!

content.en: This day is Slovenia's idea. This small country has two million people. But it's buzzing with bees. It has more than eleven thousand beekeepers!
content.tw: 這個節日是斯洛維尼亞發明的，這個小小的國家 2 百萬人中，超過 1 萬 1 千人工作是養蜜蜂!

content.en: Slovenia works hard to keep its bees healthy. Many bees around the world have been getting sick and dying. Lots of things are making this happen. But Slovenia found one big bad thing. An insect killer for farms and gardens kills bees. Now it cannot be used there.
content.tw: 世界許多蜜蜂快速死去，斯洛維尼亞發現是一種殺蟲劑惹的禍，現在在那裏被禁止使用。

content.en: Slovenia's cities plant trees and flowers. They're good for bees. But Slovenia can't keep bees healthy alone. It shows other countries how to help bees. It wants more countries to help bees. Why?
content.tw: 斯洛維尼亞種許多植物，讓蜜蜂好好生長，他們希望其他國家一起幫助蜜蜂，為甚麼呢?

content.en: Bees help give us broccoli, apples, almonds, and much, much more! They give us honey! With no bees, everyone will be hungry.
content.tw: 沒有蜜蜂的話，我們會挨餓，像是花椰菜、蘋果和杏仁等食物會消失，也會再也吃不到蜂蜜了!

content.en: On World Bee Day, let's think about what we can do for bees. Let's plant flowers and make Taiwan a healthy country for bees!
content.tw: 在蜜蜂日這天，讓我們想想可以為蜜蜂做些什麼，種花讓台灣成為蜜蜂健康的國家!

vocabulary.preface: 小蜜蜂飛來飛去，製造蜂蜜，還幫助農作物的繁殖。

content.text:
1. garden 花園。
Wow, such a beautiful garden! 哇，好漂亮的花園 !
And so many bees and butterflies! 還有這麼多蜜蜂跟蝴蝶。

2. food 食物。
I'm not a fan of bees. 我不是蜜蜂的粉絲。
I got stung once and it hurt! 我有一次被蜜蜂叮了，好痛!
Gee, I'm sorry to hear that. 真遺憾聽到你那樣。
But at least bees give us food. 不過蜜蜂至少會提供食物。

3. hungry 飢餓的。
You mean honey? 你是說蜂蜜嗎?
I don't like that either. Too sweet. 我也不喜歡，太甜了。
That's because you're not hungry right now. 那是因為你現在肚子不餓。

4. flower 花卉。
So would you like to see more flowers or go back ? 所以你想多看看花還是回去?
Let's go back. 我們回去吧。

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我讀今天的單字。
garden花園 food食物 hungry飢餓的 flower花卉

quiz.question: 1. How many people live in Slovenia?
2. What do bees help give us?
3. With no bees, what will everyone be?

content.en: Brazil is a country in South America. It's famous for many things. Carnival is Brazil's most famous celebration. Many cities there have big, big parties! There's lots of music and dancing. Many people wear colorful costumes!
content.tw: 南美洲巴西最會辦派對! 他們的嘉年華有很多音樂表演、舞蹈，還有五彩繽紛的變裝!

content.en: Millions of people go to Carnival every year. But thieves go too. Thieves want to take money, phones, and other things from people. Brazil's police try to keep people safe from thieves. It's not easy. When thieves see the police, they run!
content.tw: 每年有好幾百萬人去巴西朝聖，但小偷們也來了，錢跟手機他們都不放過，一看到警察就開溜!

content.en: Last year, police in one city did something new. They wore costumes to Carnival too! No one knew they were police. It was easy for them to catch thieves. So this year, they wore costumes again. They wore superhero costumes, and other fun costumes!
content.tw: 從去年開始，警察們想到新花樣，他們跟著大家穿著華麗的衣服，就不會被小偷認出來!

content.en: Thieves like to take people's phones. Police wearing superhero costumes caught one thief who had seven phones! In a few days, they caught six thieves and found 23 phones! People cheered!
content.tw: 穿著超級英雄服裝的警察，好幾天內，一口氣抓 6 個小偷，找回 23 支手機，真過癮!

content.en: At this celebration, people see superheroes keeping them safe! How exciting!
content.tw: 在這個慶典上，人們看到超級英雄保護他們的安全，真令人興奮!

vocabulary.preface: 里約嘉年華的大遊行裡面，假扮成超級英雄的警察，抓到好幾名扒手。

content.text:
1. thief 小偷。
Oh my Gosh! Where's my wallet? 天哪，我的皮夾呢?
You lost it? 搞丟了嗎?
It was right here in my bag! 之前就在我包包裡。
Now it's gone! 現在不見了。
I can't believe we have thieves on the MRT. 我不敢相信捷運上有小偷。

2. police 警察。
We're about to arrive at the station. 我們就要到站了。
We can report it to the police there. 可以在那裏向警察報案。

3. costume 戲服。
Do you think it's the girl in the blue costume? 會不會是那個穿藍色戲服的女孩?
The one that stood close to you? 之前站得離你很近的那個人嗎?

4. find 找到。
Maybe. But I'm sure the police can find the right person.
也許。不過警察肯定會找到正確的人。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪些單字?
thief小偷 police警察 costume戲服 find找到

quiz.question: 1. What is Brazil's Carnival?
2. When did police in one city do something new?
3. How many phones did the police find?

title: Old Ship Gets a New Life in the Ocean

content.en: What happens to old ships? Some become museums or hotels. Some are recycled. And some help ocean animals!
content.tw:
不再使用的舊船要如何處理?
可以變成旅館或博物館，或是被回收，也許還能幫助海洋動物!

content.en: About seventy years ago, a big ship was the fastest ship to cross the ocean! It was beautiful inside. Rich and famous people loved it. Walt Disney made a movie on it!
content.tw: 七十多年前，當時一艘巨大的郵輪以破紀錄的速度橫渡大西洋，有錢以及名人很愛它，迪士尼還把它拍成電影!

content.en: But after many years, most people used planes. The ship stopped crossing the ocean. It stayed in one place. People didn't know what to do with it…
content.tw: 但是多年之後，大家只搭飛機不坐船，這艘船失去作用，人們不知道該拿它怎麼辦。

content.en: But an old ship can be a reef! Oceans need more reefs. Reefs are homes for ocean animals. Corals make reefs. But coral reefs grow slowly. They die when the ocean is too warm.
content.tw: 舊的船可以成為人工礁石，變成海底動物的家。珊瑚長得很慢，還會因為海水暖化而死亡，船可沒有這個問題。

content.en: So this ship will be a reef! Workers will carefully clean it. It will be safe for ocean animals and people! Then workers will put it on the ocean floor.
content.tw: 工作人員會仔細清理這艘船，確保它不會對動物或人造成危險，再放到海床。

content.en: Corals will grow on the ship. Fish will swim in the rooms and halls. People will dive to it and go inside.
content.tw: 珊瑚會在船上生長，各種魚類在船裡游來游去，潛水玩家還可以進去探險!

content.en: The ship won't cross the ocean again. But it will have a new life helping ocean animals!
content.tw: 這艘船不會再橫渡大西洋，但它會有新的生命，幫助海洋動物!

vocabulary.preface: 一艘已經廢棄的大郵輪，即將成為海底人工礁石，讓海洋生物悠遊。

content.text:
1. ship 船。
The fish must be surprised when they see the ship. 魚兒看到船一定很驚訝。
They would think it's strange corals.他們會以為那是奇怪的珊瑚。

2. inside 在裡面。
Yeah, corals with windows and doors. 對啊，有窗戶跟門的珊瑚。
And they may even find a TV inside! 他們甚至可能在裡面發現一台電視機。

3. reef 礁石。
It'll be the coolest reef on the block! 那會是周圍最酷的礁石。
The fish, crabs and shrimps can have a party there! 魚蝦螃蟹可以在那裏開派對!

4. home 家。
They can make the ship a home for everyone! 他們可以把那艘船弄成每個人的家。
Except for the sharks. 除了鯊魚之外。
Poor sharks! 可憐的鯊魚。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡大海嗎?來讀一遍單字。
ship船 inside在裡面 reef礁石 home家

quiz.question: 1. What did the old ship do?
options: a. Crossed the ocean the fastest

quiz.question: 2. What will the old ship be?
3. What will grow on the old ship?

content.en: Some of us talk to our plants. Did you know that plants talk, too? But they don't talk like we do. And we cannot hear them talk. So how do we know plants talk?
content.tw: 你知道植物會說話嗎? 只是跟人類方式不同，我們也聽不到，那怎麼知道的呢?

content.en: Scientists studied two groups of plants: healthy plants and stressed plants. Some stressed plants needed water. Some were cut!
content.tw: 科學家研究兩群植物，一群很健康，另一群是被修剪或需要澆水的植物，它們壓力很大。

content.en: The scientists put microphones next to the plants. These microphones found sounds we cannot hear. The scientists made the sounds loud with a computer. They heard clicks and pops! They studied the sounds.
content.tw: 科學家在植物旁邊裝置一種麥克風，可以把細微的聲音放大。他們聽到霹哩啪啦的聲音! 於是把聲音放進電腦研究。

content.en: What did they find? Healthy plants make almost no sounds. But stressed plants can make forty sounds in one hour!
content.tw: 他們發現什麼? 健康的植物很沉默，但壓力大的植物一小時會發出四十多次聲音!

content.en: The scientists say maybe the clicks and pops tell other plants there's danger. They say maybe animals and insects can hear plants. So maybe the animals and insects won't eat stressed plants. Maybe insects won't put their eggs on stressed plants.
content.tw: 也許那些聲音會警告其他植物有危險，也許動物或是昆蟲聽得到，就不吃那些植物，或選擇不在上面產卵。

content.en: The scientists think farmers can use microphones someday. Then the farmers will know which plants need help.
content.tw: 科學家認為農夫未來可以使用這些麥克風，就知道哪一些農作物有麻煩了。

content.en: Look at the plants around you. Do they need water? They're trying to tell you!
content.tw: 看看你周圍的植物，它們需要水嗎? 它們正在試著告訴你!

vocabulary.preface: 科學家說植物會發出聲音，傳遞訊號。

content.text:
1. talk 談話。
Hi, don't you look beautiful today? 你今天真美呢…
Are you talking to the flowers? 你在跟花講話嗎?
Yeah, I am. 對，我是。
Oh, so you believe plants can hear. 所以你相信植物聽得到。

2. think 想或是認為。
Not with ears.不是用耳朵。
But I think they can feel it. 但是我想它們能感覺。
They can feel your goodwill. 能感覺到你的善意。

3. stressed 有壓力。
I also read that they can get stressed if you cut them.
我還有讀到說，要是你修剪植物，它會感覺到壓力。

4. loud 大聲的。
Just keep them in a nice place. 就把它們擺在一個好地方。
And try not to be too loud. 然後不要太大聲。
I already feel stressed. 我已經感覺到壓力了。

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我讀單字。
talk談話 think想或是認為 stressed有壓力 loud大聲的

quiz.question: 1. Which plants make more sounds?
2. How many sounds can these plants make in one hour?
3. Who may hear sounds plants make?

title: Japanese Man Sees Taiwan's Most Beautiful Scenery

content.en: A young man from Japan visited Taiwan. He wanted to see Taiwan's beautiful scenery. He got on his bike. He wanted to ride all the way around Taiwan.
content.tw: 一個日本年輕人想看台灣最美麗的風景，所以他跳上腳踏車，要繞台灣一圈。

content.en: But in Yunlin, his tire popped! He stood on the side of a busy road. He waited for help.
content.tw: 但腳踏車的輪胎在雲林爆胎了!他只好站在路邊等待幫手。

content.en: Two people on bikes stopped to help. But the two people and the Japanese man couldn't understand each other.
content.tw: 兩個腳踏車騎士停下來想幫他，但是他們沒辦法跟日本遊客溝通。

content.en: Then a police officer saw the three people on the side of the road. He stopped to help. But the officer and the Japanese man couldn't understand each other.
content.tw: 警察看到路邊站了三個人，也停下來幫忙，但警察也沒辦法跟日本遊客溝通。

content.en: They used their hands to talk. That was hard to understand. But they didn't give up. The officer used an app on his phone. They talked!
content.tw: 他們努力不懈比手畫腳，警察拿出手機 app 翻譯，兩方終於開始對話。

content.en: Then the officer did something better. He called his son. His son is studying Japanese.
content.tw: 警察的兒子剛好在學日文，他趕快打給兒子。

content.en: The officer called a bike shop too. Someone came and fixed the man's tire.
content.tw: 警察也找腳踏車行來修理輪胎。

content.en: The man was happy. He said the most beautiful scenery in Taiwan is the Taiwanese people!
content.tw: 這位日本遊客很開心，他說台灣最美麗的風景是台灣人!

vocabulary.preface: 日本遊客在語言不通的台灣遭遇困難，還好有人幫忙。

content.text:
1. understand 了解。
I think we're lost. 我想我們迷路了。
You think? 你想?
We've just passed that sign twice! 我們剛剛才經過那個標誌兩次。
Do you understand the sign? 那個標誌你懂嗎?
Not a word.一個字也不懂。

2. call 打電話。
We need to call the police.我們得打電話給警察。
But we won't understand the answer.但是我們聽不懂回答。

3. stand 站著。
We can't just stand here and wait.我們不能站在這裡乾等。
Maybe we can wave to cars passing by.也許可以對開過去的車子揮手。

4. give up 放棄。
And say what? 要說什麼呢?
I don't know. I only know that we can't give up.不知道。我只知道不能放棄。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字都是動詞。
understand了解 call打電話 stand站著 give up放棄

quiz.question: 1. What did the Japanese man want to see?
2. What did the officer and the man first use to talk?
3. What did the officer's son do?

content.en: A mom in Yunlin has a daughter. She took her daughter to the doctor. The doctor told the mom her daughter needed to eat many kinds of food. What if her daughter didn't want to? The doctor said the mom needed to find ways to get her daughter to eat them.
content.tw: 雲林一個女孩長不高，醫生告訴媽媽，要讓她吃各式各樣的食物，媽媽該怎麼做呢?

content.en: So the mom started cooking. She made many kinds of food. She made cakes! She made noodles! She made steamed buns!
content.tw: 媽媽學煮菜，絞盡腦汁做各式各樣的食物，像是蛋糕、麵條跟饅頭!

content.en: But this mom's steamed buns were different. They were cute! It was a way to get her daughter to eat them!
content.tw: 這些饅頭可不一般，它們有可愛的造型! 這樣女兒終於會想吃了吧!

content.en: And now the mom is a steamed bun artist! She draws cute, colorful, and fun buns! Then she makes them!
content.tw: 媽媽一做成了專家! 她先畫可愛、五顏六色的草稿，然後做成饅頭。

content.en: Some look like Halloween pumpkins! They have cute, scary faces. Some look like pink baby pigs! Her best buns look like Taiwan blue magpies. They won an award!
content.tw: 有萬聖節南瓜、粉紅小豬造型的饅頭，最厲害的是台灣藍鵲饅頭，還贏得了大獎!

content.en: Finding ways to make her daughter eat many foods changed the mom's life! Now she has an online shop. And she teaches people how to make cute buns at schools!
content.tw: 媽媽原本只是為了讓女兒長高，現在卻開了網路商店，還在學校教學生做可愛饅頭!

content.en: Do you want to try a cute steamed bun?
content.tw: 你想試試可愛的饅頭嗎?

vocabulary.preface: 這位媽媽做饅頭做出了名聲，上網也買得到。

content.text:
1. daughter 女兒。
You should see my daughter today. 你今天應該看看我女兒。
She's cooking again? 她又在煮東西了嗎?
She is. She's baked a big pumpkin pie. 對，她烤了一個好大的南瓜派。
My favorite pie! 我最喜歡的派!

2. look like 看起來像。
That's why I'm telling you this. 這是為什麼我跟你說。
You'll love it. It looks like a giraffe.你會很喜歡的，它看起來像長頸鹿。

3. colorful 五顏六色。
The pie looks like a giraffe?! 南瓜派像長頸鹿?!
No, just kidding. 不是啦，開玩笑的。
But it IS quite colorful. 不過它的確色彩繽紛。

4. try 嘗試。
Hmmm, I'm not sure if I want to try it....我不確定想不想試吃...
Don't worry, the flavor should be good. 別擔心，味道應該很好。

vocabulary.postscript:
來複習單字。
daughter女兒 look like看起來像 colorful五顏六色 try嘗試

quiz.question: 1. Where did the mom take her daughter?
2. Which of the mom's cute steamed buns won an award?
3. Where is the mom now teaching classes?

title: A Company's 100th Year of Flying Blimps

content.en: Blimps are airships. They look like whales in the sky! They're full of a gas. This gas is lighter than air. The gas makes blimps go up.
content.tw: 飛船就是飛行的船，長得很像鯨魚，裡面充滿比空氣輕的氣體，所以可以升到空中。

content.en: Blimps fly slower and lower than airplanes. People can see them easily. Some blimps can show big pictures and words. These slow and low blimps can show them to many people!
content.tw: 飛船飛得低，速度也慢，所以地上的人能清楚看到飛船上的字跟圖片。

content.en: A big tire company makes and uses blimps. Their blimps show pictures and words about tires and other things people can buy. These blimps have been doing this for 100 years!
content.tw: 一家輪胎公司會製造飛船，上面寫著公司名稱打廣告，飛船當廣告工具已經一百年!

content.en: Blimps can also stay in one place in the air. The company's blimps have cameras. When people watch TV, sometimes they see videos of big sports events taken by the blimps! This year, the blimps are going to many events!
content.tw: 飛船也可以停在空中拍照或錄影，電視裡的大型運動比賽轉播，有時候就是飛船拍的!

content.en: For this 100th birthday, four blimps are flying above 100 cities in North America and Europe. And a few lucky people will win a ride on one of them!
content.tw: 今年是飛船推出 100 年，四艘飛船會飛過 100 個歐洲和北美城市，幸運的人能乘坐它們!

content.en: Blimps are fun to watch! If you see a whale in the sky, wave hello! It might be a blimp!
content.tw: 飛船很有趣，如果你看到空中有鯨魚，記得揮手打招呼，可能是飛船哦!

vocabulary.preface: 廣告飛船是很有歷史的打廣告方式，今年滿一百年。

content.text:
1. in the air 在空中。
That airplane is so high! 那架飛機飛得好高!
It seems to be floating in the air.好像飄浮在空中。

2. above 在上面。
I once took a ride in a hot-air balloon. 我有一回搭熱氣球。
Oh, I've never done that.我從來沒有搭過。
It's amazing! 很精彩呢!
Above rice fields and trees,你在稻田跟樹林上面，
you feel as if you're flying.感覺真的在飛。

3. slow 緩慢的。
Did you go up fast? 你們上升得很快嗎?
No, it was slow. 沒有，很慢。

4. full of 裝滿。
I hope to travel like that someday. 我希望有一天那樣旅行。
My basket will be full of food and blankets.我的籃子裡會裝滿吃的，還有毛毯。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有搭過飛機嗎?
in the air在空中 above在上面 slow緩慢的 full of裝滿

quiz.question: 1. What makes blimps go up?
2. How many years has one company used blimps for messages?
3. Where do the company's blimps fly?

content.en: Being out in the sun with friends feels good! Doing this when we're exercising, having fun, and helping others feels GREAT!
content.tw: 在太陽下跟朋友玩很享受，如果可以同時運動跟幫助人，感覺更棒!

content.en: About three hundred people met one day. Some were adults and many were kids. Schools sent lots of students! The people were meeting to exercise. There were hundreds of exercise bikes!
content.tw: 有一天，300 個大人小孩聚在一起運動，還有學校派學生參加，現場有好幾百台腳踏車。

content.en: But these bikes are not like the bikes in gyms or sports centers. And they are not like the bike in your living room … you know, the one your dad or mom doesn't use anymore! These exercise bikes make electricity!
content.tw: 但這些腳踏車不是一般健身房那種，它們可以發電!

content.en: The people got on the bikes. They started pedaling! As they pedaled, the bikes made electricity. The more the people pedaled, the more electricity they made!
content.tw: 這些人坐上腳踏車猛踩踏板，這些踏板會發電，所以越多人踩踏板，就能製造越多電力!

content.en: Together the people made more than 10,000 watts of energy. That can give electricity to two homes for 24 hours! They gave the electricity they made to people who need it.
content.tw: 他們製造超過 1 萬瓦電力，可以供兩個家庭使用 24 小時，最後電力送給需要的人。

content.en: Everyone had a great day! Together with their friends, they exercised, had fun, and helped others!
content.tw: 大家都度過了美好的一天! 他們跟朋友一起運動、玩樂，還幫助了別人!

vocabulary.preface: 騎腳踏車可以發電，電力還可以供應住家呢!

content.text:
1. exercise 運動。
That was lots of fun! 真是有趣!
Yeah, I forgot how much I enjoy biking. 對啊，我都忘了我有多喜歡騎車。It's great exercise too! 它也是很棒的運動。
I hope I burned at least 500 calories. 我希望至少燒掉了五百卡路里。

2. gym 健身房。
And it's way better than the gym. 比健身房好多了。
Totally. Fresh air and sunshine win every time! 當然輸給新鮮空氣跟陽光。

3. together 一起。
We should do this every week. 我們應該每星期都來。
Good idea. Let's do it together with the kids. 好主意，來跟小孩一起騎。

4. pedal 踩踏板。
My 3-year-old has yet to learn how to pedal. 我的三歲小孩還沒有學會踩踏板。
No worries. He'll learn fast. 別擔心，他會學很快的。

vocabulary.postscript:
